bill_title: require a driver or owner of a moped used on a public highway to maintain a form of financial responsibility on the moped.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a driver or owner of a moped used on a public highway to maintain a form of financial responsibility on the moped. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-35-113 be amended to read as follows: 32-35-113. Every driver or owner of a motor vehicle , required to be registered in this state, or of a moped as defined in § 32-3-1 that is being driven on a public highway shall at all times maintain in force one of the forms of financial responsibility on the motor vehicle or the moped by one of the following methods: (1) Having in force on the motor vehicle an owner's policy of liability insurance as provided in § 32-35-70; (2) Having in force a bond as provided in § 32-35-83; (3) Having a certificate of deposit of money or securities as provided in § 32-35-87, but in the amount of fifty thousand dollars; or (4) Having a certificate of self-insurance, as provided in §§ 32-35-90 and 32-35-91, supplemented by an agreement by the self-insurer that, with respect to accidents occurring while the certificate is in force, he the self-insurer will pay the same amounts that an insurer would have been obligated to pay under an owner's motor vehicle liability policy if it had issued such a policy to said the self-insurer. Failure to maintain financial responsibility is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 32-35-114 be amended to read as follows: 32-35-114. Every person , who drives a motor vehicle, required to be registered in this state, or who drives a moped as defined in § 32-3-1 on a public highway, if requested by a law enforcement officer as a secondary action when the driver of the vehicle is detained for a suspected violation of Title 32 or some other offense, shall provide evidence of financial responsibility. Section 3. That § 32-35-116 be amended to read as follows: 32-35-116. If a driver of a motor vehicle required to be registered in the state or of a moped as defined in § 32-3-1 that is being driven on a public highway is cited for a violation of Title 32 or is involved in a reportable motor vehicle accident, the driver of the motor vehicle or moped shall furnish written evidence of financial responsibility upon request of the law enforcement officer issuing the citation or investigating the accident. The law enforcement officer shall indicate whether the driver has produced evidence of financial responsibility on the citation and shall write the driver's evidence of financial responsibility on the accident report. If the driver fails to provide evidence of financial responsibility at the time the citation or the accident report is issued, the law enforcement officer may issue the driver a citation for a violation of § 32-35-113.
